Suggestion: Use a different algorithm, such as SHA-256, with a larger, non-repeating salt.

Name: memalign
Warning: On some systems (though not Linux-based systems) an attempt to free() results from memalign() may fail. This may, on a few systems, be exploitable.  Also note that memalign() may not check that the boundary parameter is correct (CWE-676).
Suggestion: Use posix_memalign instead (defined in POSIX's 1003.1d).  Don't switch to valloc(); it is marked as obsolete in BSD 4.3, as legacy in SUSv2, and is no longer defined in SUSv3.  In some cases, malloc()'s alignment may be sufficient.
